did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Papers, 1927-2006 (bulk 1991-2005). This collection is comprised of the papers of J.A. Jance. The bulk of the material relates to her prolific literary career. Items include correspondence; published and unpublished writings including manuscripts, articles, short stories, adaptations and speeches; printed materials including book covers, mystery magazines and newsletters and news clippings; correspondence; photographs; audiovisual material including audiotapes, videocassette tapes and computer files; and objects including plaques, a computer and promotional items.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: J.A. (Judith Ann) Jance was born in Watertown, South Dakota in 1944 but grew up in Bisbee, Arizona. After graduating from Bisbee High School, Ms. Jance attended the University of Arizona and graduated in 1966 with a Bachelor's of Arts Degree in English and Secondary Education. In 1967 she married her first husband, a fellow graduate from the University of Arizona. She worked as an English teacher at Pueblo High School until 1968. She received a Master of Education in Library Science in 1970 and became a librarian in the Indian Oasis School District on the Tohono O'odham reservation. While living on the reservation where both she and her husband taught, Ms. Jance's husband received a ride home from a serial killer who eventually stalked the couple. Mr. Jance was able to help the police identify the suspect which led to his arrest.

In 1980 Ms. Jance divorced her husband and moved to Seattle, Washington with her two children. There she sold life insurance before marrying her second husband in 1985. In 1982, Ms. Jance began writing her first true crime novel based on her experience with the serial murderer on the Tohono O'odham reservation which was never published. Ms. Jance then wrote her first mystery fiction novel which was published in 1985. After publishing her novel Ms. Jance turned to writing full time. J.A. Jance is a prolific author who has written mystery novels in several series including the J.P. Beaumont, Joanna Brady and Ali Reynolds series as well as several thrillers, a book of poetry based on her marriage to an alcoholic, and several books in a children's personal safety series.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into 7 series. The Writings and Audiovisual series each contain three subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1927-2006 (bulk 1991-2005). This collection consists of materials which document the literary career of mystery writer J.A. Jance. The bulk of the material is comprised of drafts of manuscripts, articles and short stories as well as printed materials including news clippings and various mystery newsletters and magazines. The collection also contains correspondence, photographs, audio visual materials and objects.

Arrangement: Alphabetical. This series contains biographical materials associated with J.A. Jance. It includes certificates, news clippings, receipt of an honorary degree and reports from high school assignments.

Arrangement: Alphabetical. This series contains letters from various editors, publishers and fans relating to J.A. Jance's literary works as well as letters arranging Ms. Jance's tours and events schedule.
Arrangement: Alphabetical. This series contains the published and unpublished writings of J.A. Jance. The Writings series is divided into three subseries:
Articles and Short Stories (1966-2005) contains drafts of articles and short stories for magazines and anthologies as well as personal editorial responses to newspaper articles.
Miscellaneous (1993-1996) contains film and radio adaptations of J.A. Jance's novels as well as a speech given by Jance.

scopecontent.p: Arrangement: Alphabetical. This series contains printed materials including book covers for J.A. Jance's novels, programs for various mystery writers' events, mystery fiction magazines and newsletters and publicity materials including news clippings and event posters.

Sisters in Crime- Books in Print. 2001-2004

scopecontent.p: Arrangement: Alphabetical. This series contains photographs of J.A. Jance at various events. Also included are several personal photographs (mostly unidentified).
Arrangement: Chronological. This series contains audiovisual materials pertaining to Ms. Jance's literary career. The Audiovisual Materials series is divided into three subseries:
Audiotapes (1987-2005) contains audiocassette tapes and compact disks. Included are various interviews and speaking events. Some materials are in Dutch.
Videotapes (1986-2005) contains VHS tapes of various interviews and speaking events.
Computer Files (1987-1997) contains floppy disks (3 1/2 and 5 1/2 inch disks) of computer programs mostly for Ms. Jance's 1983 Eagle computer as well as drafts of manuscripts.

scopecontent.p: Arrangement: Alphabetical. This series contains plaques and other objects relating to the promotion of Ms. Jance's literary works. Also included is Ms. Jance's original computer used to write her first novels.
